title: Ticket #3926: how can I set CLASSAD_LIFETIME=121 and not miss any ads?
description:
This issue should ultimately be resolved via a documentation fix either in the manual or the wiki.

I want to set CLASSAD_LIFETIME=121 and *_UPDATE_INTERVAL=60 for all daemons.

If you set CLASSAD_LIFETIME=121 but don't correctly set UPDATE_INTERVAL for all daemons, random daemon ads start getting dropped and all heck breaks loose in the pool. (I learned this the hard way.)

The problem is that it's not well-documented which *_UPDATE_INTERVALS exist and need to be set. I know about:

UPDATE_INTERVAL SCHEDD_UPDATE_INTERVAL MASTER_UPDATE_INTERVAL NEGOTIATOR_UPDATE_INTERVAL

Is there one for the checkpoint server? The shadow? The starter? The collector itself (for when there are >1)?

Is there anything else that needs to be set so that this works?
remarks:
2013-Sep-17 15:38:00 by gthain:
Each of the daemons has a different knob for their update period:

Note that the shadow and the starter don't talk to the collector, so they don't have a corresponding update interval knob. 

Startd:  UPDATE_INTERVAL
Negotiator: NEGOTIATOR_UPDATE_INTERVAL
Collector: COLLECTOR_UPDATE_INTERVAL
Master: MASTER_UPDATE_INTERVAL
Schedd: SCHEDD_INTERVAL
Checkpoint Server: CKPT_SERVER_INTERVAL

2013-Sep-17 15:45:39 by pfc:
Thanks! FYI, I'm not going to test this until #3925 is resolved so that I'm not creating a moving target...

2013-Sep-17 16:22:04 by pfc:
Also, just to be precise, is the above list believe to be the complete list of daemon update knobs that need to be set in a Condor pool? What about other DaemonCore code like DAGMan? I don't care about Quill or Stork -- but if I did, would I need to set those too?

2013-Sep-17 16:31:59 by gthain:
DAGman doesn't put an ad in the collector

Quill is a contrib and not supported. If it were supported, you would set UPDATE_INTERVAL

Stork is now supported by SUNY-Buffalo.

2015-Jan-12 13:25:48 by pfc:
So the following is indeed a complete list of what needs to be set so that nothing is left unsynchronized with the collector's CLASSAD_LIFETIME?

  • UPDATE_INTERVAL
  • SCHEDD_UPDATE_INTERVAL
  • MASTER_UPDATE_INTERVAL
  • NEGOTIATOR_UPDATE_INTERVAL

Can this be updated in the docs (ideally, where CLASSAD_LIFETIME is explained)?
